item.title: Best Grit To Sand Epoxy Primer Before Filler Or Sealer
item.description: Learn the best grit to sand epoxy primer before filler or sealer, with pro techniques, workflows, and troubleshooting for a paint-ready surface.
item.summary:
Primer Sanding Grits for Epoxy Before Filler or Sealer

Saturday morning, the garage door yawns open and the light falls across your project—maybe it’s the fender you’ve wrestled straight after months of small fixes, or a truck hood you promised yourself you’d finish before the weather turns. The radio is low, the coffee is cooling, and the bench is lined with sandpaper packs in every color and number. You know this stage matters: what you do next determines whether your basecoat glides on like glass or telegraphs every ripple, pinhole, and scratch. But there’s a nagging question poised at the edge of the workbench. What grit is right for epoxy right now? Is 80 too coarse, 320 too fine? Where does sealer fit? That’s the difference between a finish you’re proud to show and one you’ll forever see in harsh afternoon light.

item.title: Proper Panel Degreasing Before Sanding And Painting
item.description: Learn proper panel degreasing for car surface prep: the solvents, steps, and shop tips to avoid fisheyes and get paint to stick like it should.
item.summary:
Car Surface Prep: Proper Panel Degreasing

Saturday morning, shop door cracked open, coffee perched on the fender, and a faint citrus-solvent smell in the air. That’s the moment I love most: quiet, focused, and full of possibility. You tape off the trim, set your DA sander on the cart, and reach for a clean set of nitrile gloves. If you’ve ever laid down a base coat only to watch it crater into fisheyes or peel at the edges, you know the pain of skipping a step in car surface prep. Most of the time the culprit isn’t your gun, your paint, or the weather—it’s contamination that never should have made it to the paint stage.

item.title: Best Grit Sequence For Auto Body Sanding Before Primer
item.description: Discover the best grit sequence for auto body sanding before primer. Expert tips for achieving a flawless finish every time.
item.summary:
Best Grit Sequence for Auto Body Sanding

Picture this: you’re standing in your garage, sunlight streaming through the windows, casting warm glows on the polished surfaces around you. Your project car, a vintage classic you’ve been restoring, gleams in the light, showing off all the hard work you’ve poured into it. But there’s one last hurdle before you can paint that final coat: the auto body sanding process.

Sanding is more than just a step in the restoration process; it’s an art that requires precision and patience. For both hobbyists and seasoned professionals, understanding the best grit sequence for auto body sanding before applying primer can make the difference between a flawless finish and a flawed one. It’s about achieving that perfectly smooth surface where paint adheres beautifully, ensuring a long-lasting, high-quality finish that turns heads on every drive.
